definitions.definition: A black or brownish black rock formed from prehistoric plant remains , composed largely of carbon and burned as a fuel .
examples: The coal in this region was prized by ironmasters in centuries past, who mined it in the spots where the drainage methods of the day permitted.

subdefinitions.definition: A type of coal, such as bituminous , anthracite , or lignite , and grades and varieties thereof, as a fuel commodity ready to buy and burn.
examples: Put some coal on the fire.
Order some coal from the coalyard.

definitions.definition: A piece of coal used for burning ( this use is less common in American English )
examples: Put some coals on the fire.

definitions.definition: A glowing or charred piece of coal, wood , or other solid fuel .
examples: Just as the campfire died down to just coals , with no flames to burn the marshmallows, someone dumped a whole load of wood on, so I gave up and went to bed.
I'm so sick of seeing this left-wing coal online.

definitions.definition: Bombs emitting black smoke on impact .
labels: World War I – World War II
definitions.label_groups: military slang , World War I – World War II

main_definition: ( uncountable ) A black or brownish black rock formed from prehistoric plant remains , composed largely of carbon and burned as a fuel .
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A piece of coal used for burning ( this use is less common in American English )
( countable ) A glowing or charred piece of coal, wood , or other solid fuel .
( Internet slang ) Content of low quality.
( military slang , World War I – World War II ) Bombs emitting black smoke on impact .
( slang , obsolete ) Money . [late 16th c. to early 20th c.]
